intro: Calostigma mosenii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Calostigma mosenii typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, narrow leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
